metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3248 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.Description:
openhpi/Makefile.am in OpenHPI before 3.6.0 uses world-writable permissionsfor /var/lib/openhpi directory, which allows local users, when quotas arenot properly setup, to fill the filesystem hosting /var/lib and cause adenial of service (disk consumption).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3248` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenhpi3 - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-clients - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-dynamic-simulator - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-ilo2-ribcl - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-ipmi - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-ipmidirect - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-oa-soap - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-ov-rest - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-simulator - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-slave - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-snmp-bc - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-sysfs - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-test-agent - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpi-plugin-watchdog - 3.8.0-2.1build5
openhpid - 3.8.0-2.1build5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openhpi package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.0-2.1build5').
